summary: Jewellery stock management system with dashboard for analytics, and dedicated sections for sales, purchases, and returns (split into Purchase Return and Sales Return). Each section supports Excel uploads to automatically parse jewellery scanner strings (extracting GW, SW, NW, PCS, CODE with validation) and manual data entry. Unified stock view updates in real-time as transactions are recorded. Customer ledger tracking for sales and sales returns. Factory ledger for purchases and purchase returns linked to Zyra Master Production.
architectural_notes: System designed around four main sections: Dashboard, Sales, Purchases, Returns
Excel upload functionality required for bulk data entry
Real-time stock synchronization across all transaction types
Scanner string parser must extract: Gross Weight (GW), Stone Weight (SW), Net Weight (NW), Pieces (PCS), and Product Code (CODE)
Validation layer needed for parsed jewellery data
Parser must extract CODE from first alphabet character to end of string
PCS extraction: scan backwards from CODE start, find first numeric digit (0-9), ignore spaces/dots/symbols
weightBlock cleaning: remove spaces, collapse repeated dots to single dot, remove non-digit/non-dot chars, normalize leading dot (e.g., '.050' â†’ '0.050')
Decimal splitting: try all possible combinations to find 3-number (GW, SW, NW where GW = SW + NW) or 2-number (GW, NW where GW = NW and SW = 0) valid partitions
Use exact decimal arithmetic (no floating-point tolerance); STATUS = VALID only if equation satisfied exactly, MISTAKE if structure valid but equation fails, INVALID if no valid structure
known_issues: Stock tab showing outdated/partial data (~50 items) instead of live data matching Dashboard
Stock items displaying unnecessary Sales/Purchase labels after stock update
Customer portal filtering not showing sales and returns for selected customer
Current Stock click on Dashboard does not navigate to Stock Tab
Four tabs in Sales section require scrolling on iPhone screen
Camera permission requested repeatedly instead of once per session

existing_features.title: Create a dashboard page displaying analytics for jewellery stock including total inventory value, number of pieces, and transaction summaries (sales, purchases, returns)

Create a Sales section with Excel file upload capability that parses jewellery scanner strings to extract GW (Gross Weight), SW (Stone Weight), NW (Net Weight), PCS (Pieces), and CODE fields with validation

Create a Purchases section with Excel file upload capability that parses jewellery scanner strings to extract GW (Gross Weight), SW (Stone Weight), NW (Net Weight), PCS (Pieces), and CODE fields with validation

Create a Returns section with Excel file upload capability that parses jewellery scanner strings to extract GW (Gross Weight), SW (Stone Weight), NW (Net Weight), PCS (Pieces), and CODE fields with validation
Create a unified stock view page that displays all jewellery items in inventory with their details (CODE, GW, SW, NW, PCS) and updates in real-time as sales, purchases, and returns are processed

Design a cohesive visual theme for the jewellery stock management system with elegant typography, refined color palette suitable for luxury inventory management, and consistent layout patterns across all pages

Replace the existing scanner string parser logic in frontend/src/utils/scannerParser.ts with an improved algorithm that collapses repeated dots, normalizes leading-dot decimals (e.g., '.050' to '0.050'), and uses exhaustive candidate partitioning to find valid decimal triplets (GW, SW, NW) where GW = SW + NW, or valid pairs (GW, NW) where GW = NW and SW = 0
Implement PCS (pieces) extraction by scanning backwards from the CODE start position up to 8 characters to find the first digit, which represents the piece count

Add validation status tracking with three states: VALID (exact match found), MISTAKE (valid decimal structure found but math does not satisfy GW = SW + NW or GW = NW), and INVALID (no valid decimal structure found or missing required fields)
Update the TransactionPreview component to display the validation status for each parsed item and show visual indicators (success/warning/error styling) based on the status field
Prevent submission of transactions containing items with MISTAKE or INVALID status, and display a clear error message prompting the user to correct the Excel file data before resubmitting

Rewrite the scanner string parser in frontend/src/utils/scannerParser.ts to implement deterministic CODE extraction by finding the first alphabet character [A-Z] and treating everything from that position to the end as CODE

Implement robust PCS detection in frontend/src/utils/scannerParser.ts by scanning backwards from the position just before CODE until finding the first numeric digit (0-9), ignoring spaces, dots, and other symbols, with PCS being exactly that single digit

Implement weightBlock cleaning logic in frontend/src/utils/scannerParser.ts that extracts everything before PCS, removes spaces, replaces multiple consecutive dots with a single dot, removes any characters except digits and dots, and converts leading-dot decimals (e.g., '.050') to zero-prefixed format (e.g., '0.050')

Implement exhaustive mathematical split logic in frontend/src/utils/scannerParser.ts that tries ALL possible combinations to split the cleaned weightBlock into either 3 numbers (GW, SW, NW where GW = SW + NW) or 2 numbers (GW, NW where GW = NW and SW = 0), accepting decimals with 1-3 decimal places without assuming fixed decimal length or fixed number lengths, using exact decimal math without floating point rounding

Implement STATUS determination logic in frontend/src/utils/scannerParser.ts that sets STATUS to 'VALID' when valid structure exists AND the equation is satisfied with exact equality, 'MISTAKE' when structure is found BUT the equation fails, and 'INVALID' when structure cannot be parsed, with no tolerance difference allowed

Ensure the rewritten parser in frontend/src/utils/scannerParser.ts handles all edge cases deterministically: 2-number rows (no stone weight), messy dots (multiple consecutive dots), missing leading zeros (.050 format), extra spaces throughout the string, variable decimal places (not fixed at 3), and PCS not immediately adjacent to CODE
